class.name: StoreTransaction
class.description:
This class contains details about a purchase, such as the product ID, purchase date, and expiration date (for subscriptions).
When you receive a transaction update, you must call the [method finish] method on the transaction once you have made sure that you have delivered the content to the user.

method.name: finish
method.description:
The finish method notifies the App Store that the app has successfully provided the purchased content or activated the purchased service, allowing the transaction to be completed.
Call [method finish] only after your app has delivered the content or enabled the service. If the purchase includes on-demand resources, wait to finish the transaction until the download is complete or the resources have otherwise been fully delivered.

members.member: The date when the subscription expires, as a Unix timestamp. Returns 0 if not applicable.
Whether this transaction is an upgrade of another transaction.
The transaction identifier of the original purchase.
The unique identifier of the purchased product.
The date when the purchase was made, as a Unix timestamp.
The date when the transaction was revoked, as a Unix timestamp. Returns 0 if not revoked.
The unique identifier of the transaction.
